monsters.name: Greater Water Elemental
monsters.damage_resistances: acid; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Water Form
traits.desc: The Greater Water Elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Freeze
traits.desc: If the Greater Water Elemental takes 10 or more cold damage in a turn, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet and it loses its resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Reactive
traits.desc: The Greater Water Elemental can take three reactions on every round in combat.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Greater Water Elemental makes three slam attacks, one of which it may replace with a use of its Whelm.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If this attack targets a creature restrained in the Greater Water Elemental's space, the creature must succeed on a DC +16 constitution saving throw or lose its held breath and begin to suffocate.

actions.name: Whelm
actions.desc:
Each creature in the Greater Water Elemental's space must make a DC +16 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage. If it is Large or smaller, it is also grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.
At the start of each of the Greater Water Elemental's turns, each target grappled by it takes 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the Greater Water Elemental can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a DC +16 Strength and succeeding.

reactions.name: Crashing Wave
reactions.desc: When the Greater Water Elemental is missed with a melee attack, it can move up to 5 feet toward the attacker and use it's Whelm.

monsters.name: Greater Ice Elemental
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Chip Away
traits.desc: If the Greater Ice Elemental is missing any of its hit points, its AC is reduced to 18.

traits.name: Chilling
traits.desc: A creature that touches the Greater Ice Elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) cold damage and has its movement speed reduced by 10 feet.

traits.name: Melt
traits.desc: If the Greater Ice Elemental takes 10 or more fire damage in a turn, it partially melts; its AC is reduced by 2 until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Reactive
traits.desc: The Greater Ice Elemental can take three reactions on every round in combat.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Greater Ice Elemental makes three slam attacks, one of which it may replace with a use of its Encase.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Encase
actions.desc: One creature within 30 feet the Greater Ice Elemental can see must succeed on a DC +16 Constitution saving throw or gain 2 (1d4) temporary hit points. While it has any of these temporary hit points, the creature is restrained.

reactions.name: Freezing Reposte
reactions.desc: When the Greater Ice Elemental is missed with a melee attack, it can unleash a burst of clinging ice. The attacker must succeed on a DC +14 Dexterity saving throw or take 3 (1d6) cold damage and have its movement speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Greater Thunder Elemental
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Lightning Form
traits.desc: The Greater Thunder Elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.. A creature that touches the Greater Thunder Elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it can’t take reactions until the beginning of its next turn.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the Greater Thunder Elemental is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Reactive
traits.desc: The Greater Thunder Elemental can take three reactions on every round in combat.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Greater Thunder Elemental makes three lightning javelin attacks, one of which it may replace with a use of its Thunder Clap.

actions.name: Lighting Javelin
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) lightning damage. Then make an attack roll against any creatures within 5 feet of the struck creature as the lightning jumps to them. This jumping is not recursive.

actions.name: Thunder Clap
actions.desc: Each creature within 5 feet of the Greater Thunder Elemental must make a DC [CON save] constitution saving throw. On a failure the creature takes 4 (1d8) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the Greater Thunder Elemental. Additionally, any creatures not covering their ears are deafened for 1 minute.

reactions.name: Thunder Step
reactions.desc: When the Greater Thunder Elemental is missed with a melee attack, it can teleport up to 30 feet in a crack of thunder.

monsters.name: Manta-Pseudodragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 13

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Familiar
traits.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the pseudodragon senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the pseudodragon is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the pseudodragon's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the pseudodragon can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

traits.name: Limited Telepathy
traits.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 ft. of it that can understand a language.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Nimble Escape
traits.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon makes one Bite attack and one Water Beam attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Water Beam
actions.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon shoots water in a 30-foot line. Each creature in that line must make a DC [DEX Save] dexterity saving throw, taking 3 (1d6) piercing damage on a failed save.

actions.name: Electric Pulse (While Touching Water)
actions.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon releases an electric current from its body. Any creature within 30 feet that is also touching the water must make a DC +12 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more additionally becomes paralyzed. The creature may reattempt the saving throw at the beginning of its turn.

reactions.name: Evasive
reactions.desc: The Manta-Pseudodragon can move up to its speed as a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of it. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

nested.callback: return `Kill one _${monster.name}_ for every ${monster.hp} damage dealt to the mob`
